My champion naga
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 2 Archive (PSOne): Monster Types: Naga: My champion naga
By torey_luvullo on Monday, September 18, 2000 - 04:19 am:

well, my weekend offline was spent housecleaning and raising a champion naga. took a purple hare and a striker, which dadge rated as a fine combo, and ended up with a naga with decent, but not great, starting stats, and 6 techs. took the time for 2 errantries, to get pierce and drill attack, and went to work.
this naga never got his stats as high as my other champions, but every time i took him to a tourney, with stats i thought were borderline good enough, he dominated. he ended up with only one loss, to waranmo of all monsters, and lived to 6 yrs 1 mo - colt didnt retire him at 6 yrs despite rapidly declining stat gains - with a gold and silver peach. He dominated poritoka with the following relatively weak final stats:
lifpowintskispddef
450950100950300650


All hail Hyde!

By Eagle Fierce on Monday, September 18, 2000 - 04:42 am:

Some monster tend to get modifiers on skills, sush as Golem with power, Durahan and Monol with defense, Gaboo with speed, and Phoenix with intelligence. Could Naga possibly share some of these, or maybe even all of them? If so, that would make their incredibly low lifespan understandable.

By Nate Railsback on Monday, September 18, 2000 - 08:39 am:

Well, with any offense-oriented monster (like the Naga), one can expect to either dominate the competition or be wiped out quickly yourself. With the brutal combos that a Naga can pull off, I'm not surprised that its foes fell quickly to it.

By Lisa Shock on Monday, September 18, 2000 - 08:42 am:

Great Job! I think there are (just like the hidden likes and dislikes) hidden strengths, and I always thought of the Nagas as extra nasty in tourneys.

By Black Razor on Monday, September 18, 2000 - 08:52 am:

I've told you before Torey and I'll say it again. RAISE A TRIDENT. They are, in my opinion the absolute toughest of all the Naga types.

By hengers rock on Monday, January 29, 2001 - 09:29 pm:

I think the best naga is a cyclops. wonder why? intelligence. they have as much intelligence as a durahan about, and that is plenty for me. even though life steal was much better in MR1, it can take out many monsters in 2, and re-fill ur life.

By Kurasu Soratobu on Tuesday, January 30, 2001 - 12:13 am:

However, a naga doesn't need intelligence as much as it needs power. At least the ones I raise generally don't. Nagas might have life steal and energy shot(s), but they're still much more the power creature.

Me, I'll stick with a naga/golem. Stab, anyone? *WHAP*

By mepersoner on Monday, February 12, 2001 - 03:49 am:

I've trained two types of nagas, well actually one, I tried training a pure and got fed up and stopped. I also tried a naga/suezo which with a training method of Hd, ld, ld, rest and no items, no peaches, he ended up like this Life: 369, Power: 825, Intelligence: 560, Skill: 690, speed: 45, Defense: 476, he was 4 years 4 months when I finished training him, he now gets me peaches. Oh and he's pretty strong for the extremely crappy technique I used. Oh wait! I did use items, whenever Colt said he seem stressed out I gave him a mint leaf. That's it.

By hengers rock on Monday, February 12, 2001 - 07:04 pm:

all I have to say for him as a peach finder is "naga luck"

By Rob Isaacson on Monday, February 26, 2001 - 01:26 pm:

Anyone else tried a Bazula (Naga/Gali)? A fave of mine from MR1 that actually came off quite well in the sequel! It has just about the same POW as Kurasu's beloved Trident (Naga/Golem); and gives away some LIF and DEF for boosts to SKI, SPD, and (yes) INT. You'll still mostly want to train for power, but suddenly techs like Eye Beam and Poison Breath can actually be useful!

But I still live for Pierce... *THWAP*!!!
